Sentencas: Samaria-doped ceria (SDC), with exceptional electrochemical catalyzing characteristics, is a promising material for the operating temperature of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Rapid surface kinetics enhancement via flash light sintering for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Despite its extraordinary elec- trochemical reactivity, its chemical unstable behavior in terms of reduction phenomenon has made its application to SOFC electrolyte challenging.
Titulo: Rapid surface kinetics enhancement via flash light sintering for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In regard to the defect chemistry, however, this instability can enhance the oxygen incorporation rate at the surface of the electrolyte.
Titulo: Rapid surface kinetics enhancement via flash light sintering for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here, we report a rapid surface treating method for SDC thin films via flash light sintering, which revealed an outstanding crystallinity development with nano-grains and increment of mobile dopant cation-induced oxygen vacancies within few milliseconds.
Titulo: Rapid surface kinetics enhancement via flash light sintering for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: We demonstrated that the flash light sintering-induced rapid development of crystallinity and reduction of ceria increases oxygen reducing surface kinetics, leading to an improvement in the oxygen incorporation rate of the cathodic reaction in SOFCs.
Titulo: Rapid surface kinetics enhancement via flash light sintering for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The performance of SOFC sintered by flash light indicated more than two-folds enhancement comparing the pristine cell.
Titulo: Rapid surface kinetics enhancement via flash light sintering for low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
